BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: fix incorrect permissions for /etc/resolv.conf in userns The files /etc/hosts, /etc/hostname and /etc/resolv.conf should always be owned by the root user in the container. This worked correct for /etc/hostname and /etc/hosts but not for /etc/resolv.conf. A container run with --userns keep-id would have the reolv.conf file owned by the current container user which is wrong. Consolidate some common code in a new helper function to make the code more cleaner. Signed-off-by: Paul Holzinger <pholzing@redhat.com>

COMMIT.MESSAGE: libpod: host netns keep same /etc/resolv.conf When a container is run in the host network namespace we have to keep the same resolv.conf content and not use the systemd-resolve detection logic. But also make sure we still allow --dns options. Fixes #14055 Signed-off-by: Paul Holzinger <pholzing@redhat.com>

libpod: host netns keep same /etc/resolv.conf When a container is run in the host network namespace we have to keep the same resolv.conf content and not use the systemd-resolve detection logic. But also make sure we still allow --dns options. Fixes #14055 Signed-off-by: Paul Holzinger <pholzing@redhat.com>
